images.title: Plattegrond van Amsterdam (blad middenlinks), 1625
images.description: Large map of the city of Amsterdam from 1625. Top left a view of the city and top right a map of the area. On the right a list with the names of streets on the Oude and the Nieuwe stadszijde. The floor plan is composed of nine plates, two of which are missing. This is the middle left sheet with the Waag and the Zuiderkerkhof.
images.creator: Balthasar Florisz van Berckenrode
images.source_url: http://hdl.handle.net/10934/RM0001.COLLECT.335824; other map pieces: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Balthasar_Florisz._van_Berckenrode_-_Amsterdam_(1625)_2-1.jpg; site of jewish community, details: https://spinozaweb.org/locations/3

images.title: Huis van Jeronimo Nunes da Costa (Mozes Curiël) aan de Nieuwe Herengracht te Amsterdam. Hof van den Ed: heer d'Acoste (title on object)
images.description: View of the house of Jeronimo (Hieronymus) Nunes da Costa, alias Mozes Curiël, on the Nieuwe Herengracht (now number 59) in Amsterdam. In front of the building there are a few distinguished dressed ladies and gentlemen and a carriage with two horses. The man with a hat in his hand in front of the house is possibly Nunes da Costa himself. Through the gate behind him you can see his famous garden. A covered boat in the canal. In the foreground two washing women, a reading and a spinning woman. Above a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Trekschuit bij Portugees-Joodse begraafplaats Beth Haim te Ouderkerk aan de Amstel. Begraefnis der joden buyten Amsterdam (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese-Jewish cemetery Beth Haim in Ouderkerk aan de Amstel. In the foreground a draft barge with a coffin and funeral attendants has arrived. Of the three central tombs is the middle one of Isaac Uziel and the left of Elia Montalto. At and in front of the cemetery grieving men. At the top of the middle a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Trekschuit bij Portugees-Joodse begraafplaats Beth Haim te Ouderkerk aan de Amstel. Begraefnis der joden buyten Amsterdam (title on object)
images.description: View of the Portuguese-Jewish cemetery Beth Haim in Ouderkerk aan de Amstel. In the foreground a draft barge with a coffin and funeral attendants has arrived. Of the three central tombs is the middle one of Isaac Uziel and the left of Elia Montalto. At and in front of the cemetery grieving men. At the top of the middle a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Huis van David de Pinto aan de Sint-Antoniesbreestraat te Amsterdam. Hof van de E: heer de Pinto (title on object)
images.description: View of the house of David de Pinto at the Sint-Antoniesbreestraat in Amsterdam (Huis De Pinto). In front of the building there are a few distinguished dressed ladies and gentlemen and a black servant. The man behind the fence is possibly David de Pinto himself. Different figures on the street and a carriage with four horses. In the foreground on the right a vendor of pots and pans. Top right a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Huis van baron Manuel de Belmonte (Isaac Nunes) aan de Herengracht te Amsterdam. Hof van den baron Belmonte (title on object)
images.description: View of the house of baron Manuel de Belmonte, alias Isaac Nunes, at the Herengracht (now number 586) in Amsterdam. In front of the house, a gentleman, probably Belmonte himself, distributes alms to many less fortunate. In the canal a number of boats including an elegant sloop with canopy. Top right a banderole with the title.
images.creator: Romeyn de Hooghe

images.title: Interieur van een Joodse synagoge. Synagoog der jooden (title on object)
images.description: Interior of a Jewish synagogue. In the foreground the male believers. On both sides of the room the windows of the women's quarters. In the background the rabbi who holds up the tables of the law. In the margins a legend in Dutch.
images.creator: print maker: Matthijs Pool

Vingboons, Archaeological, Historical and Geographic Institute Pernambucano, Recife 1639; From Breda: trans [1. Reefs; 2. Entrance to the Port (Well); 3. Isthmus; 4. Rio Beberibe; 5. images.title: Sklavenmarkt
images.description: The Watercolor Slave Market by Zacharias Wagener. Collection of the Dresden Kupferstich-Kabinet Published in Zacharias Wagener's "Book of Animals", the image shows a slave market, which happened in the streets of the current Old Recife. Rua do Bom Jesus/ Rua dos Judeus
images.creator: Wagenaer, Zacharias

images.title: Recife, Brazil: a street with men in high hats and uniform pointing out with long sticks the slaves they wish to purchase. Aquatint by Edward Finden after Augustus Earle.

images.title: Map of Willemstad and Surroundings by Siert Geerts, 1754
images.description: Note the additional arrows along the bottom border. The arrow, center left, points to the area designated by the letter "D" - denotes the location of Neve Shalom Synagogue in modern day Otrabanda. The arrow, center right, points to the area designated by the letter "T" referred to in the legend - Mikve Israel Synagogue. [Inset: Enlargement of the area of the walled city of Willemstad and Fort Amsterdam. Note (center right) the blue area "T" referred to in the legend]
images.creator: Siert Geerts

images.title: The "Jews Synagogue" as one of London's places of interest [Creechurch Lane]
images.description: A composite image from a map dated 1735, based on a 17th century survey

images.title: The village of Jodensavanne
images.description: The village of Jodensavanne lay on a hill on the right bank of the Suriname River. The brick synagogue was built in 1685 and is the oldest synagogue of the Americas. In the eighteenth century Jodensavanne was an important center of culture in Suriname. At the end of the eighteenth century, most residents moved to Paramaribo. In Benoits time (1830) there were still a hundred to two hundred poor Jews. In 1832 the village was destroyed by fire.
images.creator: Artist PJ Benoit; lithographer P. Lauters
images.source_orig: PJ Benoît, Voyage à Surinam (1839), pl. 43.

images.title: View of the city of Paramaribo
images.description: View of the city of Paramaribo; De Waterkant, seen upstream. To the left of the palm tree the Waag. The Waag was one of the first buildings that was rebuilt after the big city fire of 1821. When Benoit visited Suriname in 1830, the new Waag had been in use for six years. In the foreground are two pounds, cargo barges and a tent boat.
images.creator: Artist PJ Benoit; lithographer P. Lauters
images.source_orig: PJ Benoît, Voyage à Surinam (1839), pl. 7.

images.title: Shops in Paramaribo
images.description: Shops in Paramaribo; In the fatty warmer, "bazaar", on the left, you can find all sorts of merchandise: on the same shelf you can see Dutch cheese, a piece of mousseline, a ham from Bayonne and a jar of hair cream, a wig and children's toys, according to Benoit. women look at a piece of jewelery: in the tailoring workshops next to it two slaves are being sewn while a black man takes the measure for a suit.The man stays in the doorway so that passersby can see that he can afford the luxury of a suit.
images.creator: P.J. Benoit; lithographer Madou
images.source_orig: PJ Benoît, Voyage à Surinam (1839), pl. 32.

images.title: A plan of the city of New York from an actual survey, anno Domini, M[D]CC,LV
images.description: Includes item in legend: "K" "Jews Synagogue." Scale ca. 1:3,300; foot 660 to one 8 of a mile. "To the Honourable James De Lancey ... this plan of the City of New York is humbly dedict. by your honours most obet. & humble servant G. Duyckinck." Shows ward boundaries. Indexed for points of interest. Wheat & Brun. Maps and Charts (1978 ed.) 380 LC Maps of North America, 1750-1789, 1101 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Vault AACR2: 100; 440; 651/1; 651/2 Citation: Maerschalck, Francis W., -1776, and G Duyckinck. A plan of the city of New York from an actual survey, anno Domini, MDCC,LV. [New York? Printed, ingraved for, and sold by G. Duyckinck ?, 1755] Map. Retrieved from the Library of Congress, <www.loc.gov/item/73691802/>.Maerschalck, Francis W., -1776, and G Duyckinck. A plan of the city of New York from an actual survey, anno Domini, MDCC,LV. [New York? Printed, ingraved for, and sold by G. Duyckinck ?, 1755] Map. Retrieved from the Library of Congress, <www.loc.gov/item/73691802/>.
images.creator: Francis Maerschalck (d. 1776)

images.title: St. Croix
Map of Suriname made by Alexander de Lavaux in 1770
images.description: Map of Suriname made by Alexander de Lavaux in 1770, show exact position of the Joodsch Dorp (Jewish village) and Sinagoge, in Paramaribo as well as plantations in Surinam, including names of Jewish owners of plantations and exact location of the Joode Savaanne ; 1737 Alexander de Lavaux's map shows peak of Jewish comminity- 401 total plantations, David Nassy counted 115 Jewish plantations, 93 along Suriname River ner Jodensavanne, 22 in Upper Commewijne region
images.creator: Alexander de Lavaux

images.title: Plan de la riuiere de Suriname, de la ville de Paramaribo, es de fort Zelandia

images.title: New Map of Suriname showing the streams and land-zones of Suriname, Comowini, Cottica and Marawini
images.description: Map of Suriname, yellow rimmed, the areas colored. Mountains, vegetation and buildings, sites signed up. Right above the compass rose, with scale in German miles and Urengaans. Shows mainly the area to the east of Paramaribo, the northeastern part of the current Suriname.; piblished in amsterdam
images.creator: Joachim Ottens
